column5: Thanks.  Looks like I'll be mostly staying offline then.  But that's fine if it means protecting my save.  Hopefully this will get patched.

I'll be checking the format on my SD card.  I'm fairly sure it's correct, as I am sure I followed the instructions on the Nintendo website.  But I'm not certain enough not to take a look.

I've heard of that theory.  Do you think being on the receiving end of that could be a risk of corruption?  I'm trying to judge the risk of online play and whether I should continue until more is known.  I quickly learned that it was very rude to leave with the '-' because of the crashes it causes, so I don't do that.  And I haven't invited anyone onto my island yet, so I haven't had to boot anyone (and given the potential risk, I won't be now).  But I do sometimes visit others.  Could I be at risk of corruption if someone else leaves with '-' and causes a crash or the host abruptly terminates because of someone else's bad behaviour?  This has happened to me a couple of times and nothing bad has happened yet.  But I'm worried now.

A bit late to the party, but this fucking terrifies me so...

There was actually was a save corruption issue specific to Pokemon digital copies in conjunction with a specific SD card format, so it could very well be relevant.  Though I will say that I have heard of people with physical and digital copies suffering this.  

It would be more helpful in figuring this out if people would let us know whether they can attribute it to making a mistake, like turning off during saving, whether their copy is physical vs. digital, whether they have an SD card and whether they procured it form a reputable source (places like Amazon marketplace not being legit as they are flooded with fakes), and also the model of switch (OG, V2, or lite).  It's not like a hardware defect or incompatibility would be out of the realm of possibility here *cough* joy-cons *cough*.  And we should definitely ask how many of them tried to fix it, what they tried and what if anything worked.

If there is a pattern, it could help people avoid it.  And provide relief to those worrying about it.  Of course, there may not be a pattern...but isn't it worth trying?
